newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine parliament to start budget hearing June 3.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine parliament to start budget hearing June 3.

text.p: The Ukrainian parliament plans to look at this year's budget on June 3, First Deputy Finance Minister Stanislav Bukovinsky said on Friday.
"I have a parliamentary agenda which says the state budget is the first question for parliament from June 3 to 6," he told a news conference.

Heads of parliamentary commissions and party group chiefs have urged deputies to pass the budget this month, a move which would ease the way to a $2.5-$3 billion, three-year Extended Fund Facility loan from the International Monetary Fund.
President Leonid Kuchma has repeatedly slammed deputies and government for failing to pass the budget, which was given a first reading in December, and tax reforms underpinning it.
Bukovinsky said Gross Domestic Product was forecast at 100.4 billion hryvnias ($54.6 billion) while the budget deficit stood at 5.7 percent compared to 6.2 percent last year.
Annual inflation is forecast in the draft at 24.9 percent from 39.7 percent in 1996.
